candidates.definition: A built environment or installation designed for specific activities, services, or operations.

positive_examples: The manufacturing facility operates three shifts to meet production demands.
Students gathered at the campus educational facility for orientation.
The broadcasting station aired the emergency alert to all listeners.
She withdrew cash from the ATM facility outside the bank.
The bowling alley features twelve modern lanes with automatic scoring.
The postal facility processes thousands of packages daily.
negative_examples: The ancient monument stands as a testament to history.
He placed the decorative sculpture in the garden corner.
The stone bridge connects both sides of the river.
She hung the painting on the living room wall.
The metal fence surrounds the entire property perimeter.
Workers repaired the damaged pipeline section yesterday.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: Monuments, Bridges, Decorations, Barriers

candidates.definition: Built systems and structures that support transportation, utilities, and public movement through an area.

positive_examples: The city invested millions in repairing bridges and expanding the subway system.
Traffic was diverted while crews repaired the damaged section of highway.
The ancient Roman aqueducts demonstrate remarkable engineering prowess.
Construction of the new tunnel will reduce commute times significantly.
Pedestrians use the sidewalk to walk safely alongside busy roads.
The railway connects remote mountain villages to the main city.
negative_examples: The library was built in the classical architectural style.
Tourists visited the historic lighthouse on the rocky coast.
The factory produces steel components for various industries.
Archaeologists discovered ancient pottery buried in the ruins.
The hospital emergency room was crowded with patients.
Students gathered in the university's main auditorium.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: Building, Monument, Facility, Structure

candidates.definition: Enclosed or semi-enclosed spaces within or attached to buildings that serve specific functional purposes.

positive_examples: The family gathered on the covered porch for dinner.
She stored her car in the garage during winter.
The hotel balcony overlooked the ocean.
Children played in the sunny courtyard.
We converted the dusty attic into storage space.
The lanai was perfect for morning coffee.
negative_examples: The bridge connected the two buildings.
Water flowed through the concrete pipe.
The monument stood in the town square.
Cars traveled on the highway overpass.
The fence marked the property boundary.
The well provided water for the village.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: Infrastructure, Monuments, Barriers, Pathways, Utilities

candidates.definition: Structural components and elements that make up buildings and enclosed spaces

positive_examples: The contractor inspected the roof for damage after the storm
She walked through the doorway into the brightly lit room
The fireplace crackled warmly in the corner of the living room
Workers installed new ceiling tiles in the office building
The fence around the property marked the boundary clearly
Smoke rose from the brick chimney on a cold winter morning
negative_examples: The carpenter grabbed his hammer from the toolbox
The excavator dug a foundation hole for the new house
She planted flowers in the garden bed near the porch
The delivery truck parked in front of the warehouse
Construction materials were stacked on the building site
The architect drew blueprints for the proposed office complex
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: BuildingTools, Infrastructure, Furniture, Landscape, Vehicle

candidates.definition: Permanent structures designed for human occupancy, work, or specific activities.

positive_examples: The new office building downtown has thirty floors.
They converted the old factory into luxury apartments.
The casino was packed with tourists trying their luck.
Scientists worked late in the research laboratory.
The dance hall echoed with music from the 1940s band.
Security was tight around the military installation.
negative_examples: The bridge spans the entire river valley.
We parked under the concrete overpass during the storm.
The ancient statue stood in the center of the plaza.
The submarine docked at the naval pier.
Construction crews erected scaffolding around the monument.
The oil rig operated twenty miles offshore.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: Infrastructure, Monument, Vehicle, Equipment
